title: How to start being a music teacher - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a great question and one that we get a lot at USC Thornton. We have a ton of resources available (full list at the bottom) to help musicians who are passionate about teaching plan & advance their music teaching career. In short, the most common route to becoming a Music Teacher is: Earn a bachelor’s degree in music performanceComplete a teacher education program* - these programs typically involve courses in music methods and provide student teaching opportunities. They can be completed on-campus or online.Pass your state’s music teacher certification licensing exams - here’s a great resource to help you identify your state’s licensing requirements - Music Educator Certification - NAfME*Some music majors elect to minor or take a double major in a music education program during their undergraduate studies in music performance. If you’ve already graduated, returning to school for a Master’s of Music in K-12 Contemporary Teaching Practice, Music Teaching and Learning, Master’s of Music in Education, or a Master of Arts in Teaching degree, will give you the knowledge & classroom experience necessary to become certified. Additional Resources: How to Plan Your Career in Music after College Transforming the Landscape of Music Teaching Degrees [Webinar] USC’s Master of Music in K-12 Contemporary Teaching Practice Contemporary Teaching Practice Alumni Spotlight: Vince Womack 10 Things To Consider When Choosing A Graduate Music Program I hope you find the information and additional resources helpful!

Typically, you have to spend 4–5 in an undergraduate program studying music and education including a student teaching. To get into these programs you have to audition and be accepted on a specialty instrument or voice. Depending on your state requirements, you may also have to take a basic skills test and/or a competency test in music. However, you also have two other alternatives in most states. These provide ways to get certified without having an undergrad degree. Take an accelerated program and test (this is for those already with a degree in education).Take a test and have hours of experience. Most states allow schools to appoint a classroom teacher in a music position if they can’t hire a certified one right away. For those with enough hours of experience, some states will let you just take the test.Learn more about what a music degree involves: https://dynamicmusicroom.com/music-education-degree-length/
